Name:
Gambia
HMNZS Gambia
HMS Gambia
Builder: Swan Hunter, Tyne and Wear, United Kingdom
Out of service:
Transferred to the Royal New Zealand Navy, 22 September 1943
Returned to the Royal Navy on 27 March 1946
In service: Returned to the Royal Navy on 27 March 1946
Fate: Scrapped by Ward, Inverkeithing, arriving on 5 December 1968
Propulsion:
Four oil fired three-drum Admiralty-type boilers
four-shaft geared turbines
four screws
54.1 megawatts (72,500 shp)
Armament:
4 × 3 BL 6 inch Mk XXIII naval guns
4 × 2 4 inch guns
4 × 2 40 mm Bofors AA guns
3 × 4 2-pounder ("pom-pom") AA mounts
6 × 2 20 mm AA guns
2 × 3  21 inch (533 mm) torpedo tubes
Armour:
Main belt: 83 mm
Deck: 51 mm (2.0 in)
Turrets: 51 mm (2.0 in)
Director control tower: 102 mm (4.0 in)
